result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Heger in court.  
Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos Jr in court for Daniel J Heger.  
Attorney William Ackell for Stephan Eduard Nolten in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling  Conference. Defense request a resolution hearing. 
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Daniel J Heger in court with attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  
William R. F. Ackell for Stephan Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and ptential dpa offer from the State and request an adjournment.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
efiled on 7-16-2022 and addressed at the preliminary hearing on 7-18-2022
Received and Filed: Defense Motion to appear on Zoom for 8-18-2022 scheduled hearing.

Defendant Daniel J Heger in court with Attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos; both appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer M. Dederich. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Heger in court with attorney Gerardo Antonio De Los Santos.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
